subject: Re: Death in the Family "Experiment"!
author: Misty
full_text:
Sorry for your family's feeling of loss. I know the feeling all too 
well. 

I tend to run my own experiments without thought of what someone else 
will think about it so I will let ya know if they come by this way. I 
usually dont post newly crossed people out of respect to the family 
involved. I share it when the time seems right.

As for those who think it takes "time" for newly deceased to come 
thru, I tend to think it is us that needs time to heal because they 
have continually said "time does not exist" for them. It is a manmade 
function we place on ourselves due to environment and daily function 
as well as measure of life span.

I did get a Cathy coming thru repeatedly lately but not sure 
which/who she is for. Either way she just says she loves her dog 
and "this is a proper hehe mom" 

And a Tom-Son dunno who they are either. Toms son, thompson, no clue. 
all they said was "whos an alligator Tom-Son" I am bad when i dont 
recognize it or understand it so I just go phonetically for those. So 
I may be a lil off on what they say/mean.

And a Jason and a Jordan. Jasons statement sounded british he said " 
well sugar I love my mummys sunday" something. Jordan's statement was 
about someone (Chris) not killing themselves saying it was Bullsh*t. 

I dont know these spirits/people so all I can do is document and move 
on. But if yours pop up I will forward them your way.

Misty



--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "reesclarke_69" <reesclarke_69@...> 
wrote:
>
> 
> Hello guys, & gals
> 
> I hope everybody is having a great day, its a beatiful day in the 
> Bluegrass State of Kentucky.  I just had a death in my Family, and 
I 
> was wandering if anybody does a session today/or tonight if you 
could 
> try to get in contact with a Mr. Charlie Clarke,(my Great Uncle) or 
> Mrs. Joann Clarke(his wife has past a couple of months ago)to see 
if 
> you can contact them.  If you do contact him can you tell him that 
> Rees will be asking to speak with them tonight around 7-8pm eastern 
> time.  To see if they can contact me.  They lived a long and 
> wonderful life together.  So all my family is sad to see him go, 
but 
> we know it was his time to leave, and life goes on.  He should be 
> happy to be back with his wife.  (He was 83 years old)  I know 
> probaly somebody here might think this is crazy, dumb or 
> disrespectful, but that is my business. I think it should be easy 
to 
> get in contact with him since he just crossed over.  Please let me 
> know if you tried and any evidence you might get from him.
> 
> Thanks
> 
> William Rees
>
